newsitem.title: LATVIA: BA says Riga flight not hit by strike.
newsitem.headline: BA says Riga flight not hit by strike.

text.p: British Airways said on Monday that its flight between Riga and London was not affected by strike action by some cabin crews.
Some cabin crews plan three-day strikes from Wednesday after talks between management and the cabin crews' Transport and General Workers' Union (T&G) broke down in a dispute over pay and conditions.
The worst-affected flights will be BA intercontinental services from London's Heathrow and Gatwick Airports and its European services out of Heathrow.
But BA Baltics manager Harvey Lines said that Riga-London was not one of the routes that would be hit by the strike. The Riga flight goes into Gatwick.
"As of today, our flight is unaffected and we do not anticipate any disruption to the Riga-London service," Lines told Reuters.
He said passengers with onward connections may be affected but that there were a small proportion of the total passengers.
